articles.title: Eurovision 2021 song contest's top 10 favourites face showdown in Rotterdam - ABC News
articles.description: Australia's no longer in it to win it, but the good news is Europe's entries are *giving* this year. Who are you going to support out of the hot favourites to win the Eurovision Song Contest?
articles.content:
The Eurovision Song Contest is back in all its glory after a year off due to COVID-19.

articles.description: Springboks Cheslin Kolbe and Rynhardt Elstadt of Toulouse will face off against compatriots Raymond Rhule and Dillyn Leyds of La Rochelle in the European Champions Cup final.

articles.author: Pushkala Aripaka
articles.title: EU advises against second AstraZeneca shot for people with blood clots - Reuters
articles.description: The second shot of the COVID-19 vaccine developed by AstraZeneca and the University of Oxford must not be given to anyone who has had blood clots with low blood platelets after receiving the first, Europe's medicines regulator said on Friday.

articles.title: European Space Agency reveals ambitious plans to build sat-nav around the moon - Daily Mail
articles.description: The new infrastructure could turn our natural satellite into the 'eighth continent' as humanity spreads its wings and builds cities on the moon, according to the Paris-based space agency.
articles.content:
The European Space Agency (ESA) has launched an ambitious new project to build a sat-nav and communication satellite network in orbit around the moon.

articles.title: Scientists in Asia resumed work far quicker than western counterparts, international COVID lockdown - EurekAlert
articles.description: Researchers in China, Japan, and Singapore were able to resume research much quicker than their counterparts in the US and Europe after the first covid lockdowns, results of a new international survey suggest.
